topic: Deep dive: _codecs_iso2022 standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _codecs_iso2022 standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: codecs_iso2022 Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of the new additions and enhancements to the codecs_iso2022 module in Python 3.12+, focusing on its purpose, features, usage, and best practices.
key_points: Enhancements and new additions in Python 3.12+
Key use cases for the module
How to import and use the codecs_iso2022 module

code_examples.code:
import codecs

# Example usage of codecs_iso2022:

text = 'Hello, World!'
encoded_text = codecs.encode(text, 'ISO-2022-JP')

import codecs

# Decoding ISO-2022-JP encoded text:
decoded_text = codecs.decode(encoded_text, 'ISO-2022-JP')

version_notes: New additions and improvements specific to Python 3.12+
Upcoming changes and deprecations for the codecs_iso2022 module in future versions of Python
caveats: Understanding the nuances of character encoding is crucial when working with the codecs_iso2022 module
Ensure you have a clear understanding of the specific encoding scheme (e.g., ISO-2022-JP) you are using to avoid errors
